item.title: VOCALOID Opera ‘The End’ coming to Australia
item.dc:creator: Jade Kaiba
item.description:
The world’s first VOCALOID Opera, The End, made its debut in 2013. Since then, it’s traveled the world to countries including France and Germany and was even displayed on a beach. And now, in October of this year, the show will have its Australian premier at the OzAsia Festival in Adelaide. Conceived and composed by …

The post VOCALOID Opera ‘The End’ coming to Australia appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The world’s first VOCALOID Opera, The End, made its debut in 2013. Since then, it’s traveled the world to countries including France and Germany and was even displayed on a beach. And now, in October of this year, the show will have its Australian premier at the OzAsia Festival in Adelaide.

Conceived and composed by Japanese composer (and Miku fan) Keiichiro Shibuya, the show features the vocals of Hatsune Miku, costume designs by Louis Vuitton and visual design by YKBX. Unlike many Miku productions, The End focuses on slightly darker themes as Miku struggles to understand her existence and if she’s like other humans.

Promotional Video

The Adelaide Festival Centre provided a video to give fans an idea of what to expect! It also gives fans a taste of the amazing visuals in this virtual opera.

Show Times and Location

At the moment, it’s unknown if the opera will have English subtitles. However, since it usually has in the past, it’s likely safe to assume it will.

Location: Dunstan Playhouse at Festival Dr, Adelaide SA 5000, Australia

October 3rd Showing: 8PM

October 4th Showing: 8PM

Ticket Prices

Adult: $49.00 AUD
Concession*: $45.00 AUD

Purchase 4 or more shows and receive a discount.

Adult: $44.00
Concession*: $40.00

*Pensioner, Senior, Full Time Student, or Unemployed

GreenRoom Members: $30.00

All purchases online come with a $8.95 service and handling fee.

Where to Purchase

If you want to read more about the show or are looking to buy tickets to the event, you can find everything you need on the OzAsia Festival website here.

More Information

OzAsia Festival Website

The post VOCALOID Opera ‘The End’ coming to Australia appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Hatsune Miku Opera THE END Coming to Germany!
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
After appearing in France last year, the “Hatsune Miku Opera THE END” is coming to Germany! Fans can enjoy the opera on August 18th, 19th, and 20th. There will be one showing each day! Show Times All shows will be held at Kampnagel, an international center for arts. They are located at Jarrestraße 20, 22303 …

The post Hatsune Miku Opera THE END Coming to Germany! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
After appearing in France last year, the “Hatsune Miku Opera THE END” is coming to Germany! Fans can enjoy the opera on August 18th, 19th, and 20th. There will be one showing each day!

Show Times

All shows will be held at Kampnagel, an international center for arts. They are located at Jarrestraße 20, 22303 in Hamburg, Germany. They will be in Japanese with English subtitles.

Thursday, August 18th (German Premiere): 19:30 (7:30 PM)
Kampnagel – K6

Friday, August 19th: 19:30 (7:30 PM)
Kampnagel – K6

Saturday, August 20th: 19:30 (7:30 PM)
Kampnagel – K6

How to Buy Tickets

Tickets are available on the Kampnagel website. Prices for seating run from €10 to €36 EUR depending on the seating option chosen. The website also shows which seatings are still available. Simply click the link to the show you want to see, and you’ll be able to see what seats you can get as well as buy the tickets.

Thursday
Friday
Saturday

About “THE END”

Translated from the German description:

This first virtual pop-opera in the world is a spectacular, synaesthetic, overwhelming, and touching confrontation with the death wish of a digital superstar.

With more than 100,000 songs, over 170,000 YouTube videos, a big U.S. tour, and a global fan base, the turquoise-haired girl, Hatsune Miku, from Japan is one of the biggest international pop stars. The only difference from Beyoncé and other stars: Hatsune Miku is a virtual 3D-figure whose songs are made by her fans. She was released in 2007 and, since then, users have been writing songs using her voice.

One of her fans is Keichiiro Shibuya, one of the most famous young composers of piano and electronic music. With songs based on lyrics of the Japanese theater renovator Toshiki Okada, Shibuya composed an opera for Hatsune Miku, which highlights synthetic music and the latest animation technology. Hatsune Miku will be larger than life and dressed in costumes from Louis Vuitton while projected on a setting consisting of several screens. All the while, Shibuya will be live on stage accompanying her singing.

More Information

More information is available in German on the Kampnagel website. In addition, there is a Facebook event up as well.

Should any more information come up, we’ll be sure to let fans know!

The post Hatsune Miku Opera THE END Coming to Germany! appeared first on VNN.
